reviewText:
PROS-----
- Very interesting characters.
- Sashiro, the main character, shows to be very mysterious within the first few chapters.
- Qi, a psychopathic sangophile who is also Sashiro's adopted brother.
- Janna, a medic and investigator who is just as mysterious as Sashiro.
- Ronald and Dan, both seem to be pretty interesting, though their faces were never shown (at least in Chapter 0).
- Plot's good so far-- nothing amazing, but it works.

CONS-----
- Short instrumental piano music clearly synthesized via FL Studio. I'm not really fond of how the melodies sound. The editing is a bit awkward, too.
- Not enough choices. The story is trying to give you multiple choices for each situation to make it more interactive but it's limited only to random conversations that don't have any affect on the plot.

VERDICT: The novel's okay so far. Not as good as I thought it was in my head, though-- but hey, I'm still on the second chapter when I made this review. My opinion might change. Just make sure you have the volume off so you don't have to listen to the music.

reviewText:
I haven't wrote much reviews, only games that deserves one...and this one definitely deserves it.

Story: You play Sashiro, a member of a kinda world police called World-Peacemakers, who hunts terrorists.
He gets to know a terrorist leader is hidden in a high-school. In order to get it, he infiltrates the
school as student...
Pretty neat and cool plot, many dialouge options for perfect immersion (although most of them doesn't
really change the plot in a major way).

Endings:There are 3 endings, one of the endings is quite hard to achieve withouthelp"(will explain in the following soon)
I've played a lot of visual novels
date: in most of them there is a "good"(cool and satisfying) and a\n"bad"(unsatisfying
voteText: all endings are cool and satisfying.\nAlso in most other VNs it is hard or even nearly impossible to get a desired ending without googling\na walkthrough
helpfulPercent: but in this game the developers solved this problem in a very elegant and lore-abiding\nway
votesHelpful:
which ask you whether to completely reveal what to do exactly -or- just to give hints so you can
try to again yourself -or- to point out what you did wrong in the last playthrough.

Presentation: Arts are nice
votesTotal: soundtrack is ok which catches the situation.\n\nPS: Don't skip the credits
votesFunny: there's bonuscontent after that. Bonuscontent is linked to every ending
commentsCount: \nso you get total 3 different bonuscontent which is in my opinion quite entertaining!"

reviewText:
Although I haven't finished the game yet, I can say this is a good visual novel.
Here is everything a good VN should have, interesting and unique characters, good visuals, nice soundtrack.

I rate this: 91 out of 100 pts

reviewText: Art by DeviantArt, story by the weeaboo you knew back in high school yourself. There are so many better VN's out there, even for completely free, that this one is like a disgrace for the whole genre.

reviewText: This game is a gem among the Visual Novels on steam.\nStory is interesting and never gets boring, this is due to surprise twist and dialouge choices\nwhich makes the plot lively. Arts and sound are good.
